questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    when Namabanga Clinic in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency will be opened to the public; and

(b)    when the construction of staff houses at the Clinic will commence. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W17    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    when the Government will build additional classroom blocks and teachers’ houses at the following primary schools in Nchelenge Parliamentary Constituency:
(i)    Kilwa; (ii)    Kasamba; (iii)    Mantampa; (iv)    Mukumbwa;
(v)    Mubamba; (vi)    Ray of Joy; and (vii)    Chipashi;
(b)    when VIP toilets will be constructed at Kilwa and Lukwesa Primary Schools; and
(c)    when reconstruction of new infrastructure at Chisenga Primary School will commence. W18    Mr Ndalamei (Sikongo) - to ask the Minister of Local Government and Housing:
(a)    when the 2014 Constituency Development Fund (CDF) will be disbursed to all the Constituencies that have not yet been funded; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in disbursing the money. W19    Mr Ndalamei (Sikongo) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication:
(a)    when the construction of the following infrastructure at Sikongo District Headquarters will commence:
(i)    police station; (ii)    offices for the district administration; (iii)    staff houses; and (iv)    post office; and

(b)    what has caused the delay in commencing the construction works. W20    Mr Musonda (Kapiri Mposhi) - to ask the Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs what measures the Government has taken to resolve the boundary disputes between the following Chiefs:
(a)    Chief Mukubwe in Ngabwe District and Chief Mwinuna in Mpongwe District; and

(b)    Senior Chief Chipepo (Mukuni Ng’ombe) in Kapiri Mposhi District and Chieftainess Malembeka in Masaiti District. W21    Mr Kunda (Muchinga) - to ask the Vice President why only a few freedom fighters are awarded honours for their distinguished service to the nation annually, when there are many others who are yet to be honoured. W22    Mr Kunda (Muchinga) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the rehabilitation of feeder roads in Muchinga Parliamentary Constituency will commence. W23    Mr Chansa (Chimbamilonga) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication:
(a)    when construction works of the Kasaba Bay Airport, which were abandoned, will resume;
(b)    what the time-frame for completion of the project is;
(c)    what the estimated cost of the project is;
(d)    why works on the project were abandoned by the previous contractor; and
(e)    what measures have been taken against the contractor for abandoning the project. W24    Mr Kunda (Muchinga) - to ask the Minister of Youth and Sport:
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to implement youth activities in Muchinga Parliamentary Constituency in 2014;
(b)    if so, what the activities are;
(c)    what the total cost of implementing the youth activities above is; and
(d)    when implementation of the youth activities will commence. W25    Mr Mwanza (Solwezi West) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    when the Government will implement the policy of building a university in each province; and
(b)    what academic programmes will be offered at the universities. W26    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Vice President:
(a)    what assistance the Government has provided to the following in Nchelenge Parliamentary Constituency:

(i)    the 25 families who have been displaced to pave way for the upgrading of Mweru Primary School into a secondary school; and (ii)    the families at Rubber Community whose houses have been submerged in water; and
(b)    when roads and bridges in Rubber Community, which have been damaged by the rising water will be re-designed and reconstructed.
